scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-470 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-470 is a star with 1.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.66 times its radius. It is located 3032.63 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.86 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-470 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-470 system


Kepler-470 b

Kepler-470 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2016-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.23 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-470 b is 35616.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-470 b is 14.440 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-470 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-470, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-470 - System With 1 Exoplanet
